image.altText: Composite thumbnail 2024 election issues

props.synopsis: Premier Jeremy Rockliff has called the Tasmanian election for March 23 and voters are turning their minds to what is most important to them. Stateline looks at the issues that top the list of priorities.

title.children: What's important to most Tasmanians in the coming state election? Spoiler: it's not a stadium

image.altText: Orange smoke looms above a hill.

props.synopsis: Campers and residents have been evacuated from a popular coastal region of north-east Tasmania as a bushfire burns through the area.

title.children: Campers and residents evacuated as fire burns towards popular Tasmanian holiday hamlet

image.altText: a man in a blue suit.

props.synopsis: Tasmanians are heading to the polls on March 23. Who are the major players, what are the main issues the election will be fought on, and what else will we be watching out for?

title.children: It's happening: Here is everything you need to know about Tasmania's early election

image.altText: Rebecca White, Jeremy Rockliff, Rosalie Woodruff

props.synopsis: The Liberals, Labor and the Greens have started the Tasmanian election campaign in furious agreement — the state has many problems that need solving.

title.children: Tasmanian leaders in furious agreement as campaign kicks off — the state has a lot of problems

image.altText: ABC election analyst Antony Green stands with his arms folded, smiling  in a profile photo

props.synopsis: The ABC's chief election analyst Antony Green takes a look at the upcoming Tasmanian election.

title.children: Antony Green's preview of the Tasmanian election

image.altText: Ken Henry #2

props.synopsis: Australia's tax system is stacked so heavily against younger people that it's threatening the social compact, former Treasury secretary Ken Henry has warned.

title.children: 'The rental property sector in Australia is not a net taxpayer'. Former Treasury boss Ken Henry says that needs to change

image.altText: Penny Wong holding her hand up to her mouth pensively during a senate hearing.

props.synopsis: Australia's foreign minister says a ground invasion of Rafah, where a large number of Palestinians are taking refuge, would be "unjustifiable".

title.children: Wong says an Israeli ground invasion of Rafah would be 'unjustifiable'

image.altText: Fulton County District Attorney Fani Willis

props.synopsis: Lawyers for the former president are pushing for the lead prosecutor in the Georgia election interference case to be disqualified amid revelations of a secret affair with a fellow prosecutor.

title.children: This prosecutor took on Trump's alleged 'criminal racket'. Then they exposed her personal secret

image.altText: A composite image of close up shots of Anthony Albanese and Peter Dutton.

props.synopsis: Amidst the parliamentary ping-pong between Labor's hard sell of its tax cuts and the Coalition's alarm at convicted immigrants on the loose, it's become clear all sides are keeping a close eye on another issue that could prove to be a far more powerful vote driver: housing, writes David Speers.

title.children: Is the housing crisis eroding confidence in democracy?

image.altText: A close up of a man wearing a blue button up shirt standing in front of a podium delivering a speech.

props.synopsis: A former military general once banned from Australia over his human rights record is leading Indonesia's election count, according to unofficial results. Here's what that could mean.

title.children: Prabowo Subianto claims Indonesian presidential election victory as counting continues

image.altText: A flaming house number sign.

props.synopsis: Multiple homes have been destroyed by fires in Victoria's west, as tens of thousands of homes and businesses wait to be reconnected to power following Tuesday's deadly storms.

title.children: Bushfires in Victoria's west destroy 25 homes, thousands still without power

image.altText: aerial image of damaged local pool

props.synopsis: South Gippsland residents expected a regular thunderstorm as a heavy and dark cloud blanketed the region, but the reality was much more horrific.

title.children: While bushfires roared in Victoria's west, the town of Mirboo North was hit by a 'terrifying' fatal storm

image.altText: Orange flames as a fire burns through a field of trees.

props.synopsis: Residents of the Grampians in western Victoria tell how they had to make split-second decisions as fire raced towards them.

title.children: The moment of fight or flight for Victorian residents caught in bushfire terror at Pomonal

image.altText: Woman holding sign that reads 'Together against anti-Semitism'

props.synopsis: When does anti-Zionism amount to anti-Semitism? Some say the emphasis on broadening definitions detracts from the "real threat" facing Australian Jews.

title.children: Nearly 80 per cent of Australian Jews are Zionist. What does that mean?

image.altText: Leanne Shelton

props.synopsis: Freelance copywriting is one of the professions most exposed to the new artificial intelligence tools. Here's how copywriters are adapting — and what this says about the future of work.

title.children: AI killed Leanne's copywriting business. Now she earns a living teaching how to use ChatGPT

image.altText: A photo of a Chinese-Australian man Yang Hengjun, sitting on an outside table, wearing a navy polo shirt with a red collar.

props.synopsis: Meanwhile, the government's revised stage 3 tax cuts pass the House of Representatives. Follow live.

title.children: Wong says Australian's sentencing damaged China's reputation, Assange supporters push for 'political solution'

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Assange's brother: Government has 'a real mandate' to find a 'political solution'
Australia, Canada, New Zealand 'gravely concerned' by planned Rafah ground offensive
Sentencing of Yang Hengjun has damaged China's reputation, Wong says

image.altText: Lara Alexander, John Tucker and Jeremy Rockliff.

props.synopsis: Tasmanian Premier Jeremy Rockliff calls a state election for March 23, over a year earlier than planned — urging Tasmanians to not be swayed to vote for Labor, Greens or Jacqui Lambie candidates.

title.children: Tasmanian state election called after Liberal defectors snub premier's ultimatum

image.altText: Tasmanian premier Jeremy Rockliff appears to be in thought, surrounded by his colleagues in parliament.

props.synopsis: Tasmanians initially weren't expected to go to the polls until 2025 but, a year early, the election is on. What happened?

title.children: Tasmania is heading to an early election — how did the government find itself here?

image.altText: Anthony Albanese, in a blue polo shirt, standing with his wife with her left hand on his chest, showing an engagement ring.

props.synopsis: The prime minister has taken to social media to announce his engagement to his partner Jodie Haydon.

title.children: 'She said yes': Anthony Albanese engaged to partner Jodie Haydon

image.altText: Medibank

props.synopsis: A report from consumer group Choice claims health insurers have been increasing premiums for top-tier hospital cover by more than three times the amount set by the federal government in the past three years without breaking the law.

title.children: Health insurers using 'sneaky tactics' to charge more for top level hospital cover without breaking the law

image.altText: A middle-aged man in an Australian navy uniform salutes a group of sailors.

props.synopsis: During a Senate estimates hearing late on Wednesday, Vice Admiral Mark Hammond was quizzed about last year's removal of a commanding officer from a warship over claims of "unacceptable behaviour".

title.children: Parliament told of sexually inappropriate behaviour inside Royal Australian Navy

image.altText: A crowded outdoor train station with people getting off and on of trains. Others talk and look at phones.

props.synopsis: Data from the Australian Bureau of Statistics shows the unemployment rate climbed to 4.1 per cent in January, while the ASX is trading higher after a positive session on Wall Street. Follow live.

title.children: Unemployment rate hits two-year high in January, ASX trading higher after positivity on Wall Street

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Treasurer says weakening jobs market an 'inevitable consequence'
Unemployment will be a 'relief' to the RBA and contribute to rate cuts, economist says
BREAKING: Unemployment rate hits 4.1 per cent in January

image.altText: a woman in a white suit in the House of Reps smiling

props.synopsis: Australia's Water Minister Tanya Plibersek has completed the first Commonwealth water buybacks in the Murray-Darling Basin since 2020.

title.children: First water buybacks agreed in $205 million deal

image.altText: A woman is rushed to an ambulance on a stretcher.

props.synopsis: Three people have been taken into custody after at least 22 people, including minors, were hit by gunshots during a Super Bowl victory parade in Kansas City, Missouri, authorities say.

title.children: One person dead, at least 11 minors injured after shooting near Kansas City Chiefs Super Bowl parade

image.altText: Paul Papalia wears a black suit jacket and navy tie, he stands behind a row of microphones.

props.synopsis: Lawyers fire back at Corrective Services Minister Paul Papalia for his criticism of a judge's sentencing of a juvenile detainee, saying he's undermining a core democratic principle.

title.children: Lawyers slam WA corrections minister over judge criticism that 'undermines justice'

image.altText: A platypus on the surface of some water close-up swimming

props.synopsis: The discovery of a 24-year-old wild platypus gives researchers and conservationists a greater insight into the longevity of one of Australia's most unique animals.

title.children: Australia's oldest-known platypus living in the wild discovered in a Melbourne creek

image.altText: Ben Mendelsohn as Dior stands in front of Juliette Binoche as Coco Chanel, and Maisie Williams and John Malkovich in costume.

props.synopsis: Apple TV+ show The New Look brings to life a complex, rich moment in time — whether you're a fashion history buff or can barely spell Balenciaga.

title.children: Ben Mendelsohn is Christian Dior in The New Look, a TV show about high fashion's dark stains from WWII

image.altText: A brunette woman in a paramedic uniform looks up in shock in an action shot from Madame Web.

props.synopsis: The new Spider-Man spin-off starring Dakota Johnson is not about to reverse the downward spiral of the superhero industrial complex.

title.children: Dakota Johnson has charisma to burn, but even she can't save this abysmal superhero movie

image.altText: A plane at an airport.

props.synopsis: Businesses are cashing in on the Taylor Swift hype, with more than 620,000 tickets purchased for the Australian leg of the Eras Tour. We look at the impact it's having on our economy.

title.children: Taylor Swift has touched down in Melbourne — she's already making economic waves

image.altText: An aerial of a flooded town

props.synopsis: Families, children and the elderly are being flown out of the Gulf of Carpentaria as a tropical low, with a 40 per cent chance of turning into a cyclone, risks putting properties under water.

title.children: Residents evacuated in outback as possible cyclone threatens severe flooding

image.altText: A photo of the Services Australia website with a blue background.

props.synopsis: Some Australians have waited more than 100 days to have their Paid Parental Leave, JobSeeker and Disability Support Pension payments approved.

title.children: Feel like you've waited months to get an answer about your pension? You're not alone

image.altText: Manasseh Sogavare gestures while speaking.

props.synopsis: Opposition politicians in the Solomon Islands are vowing to make public or even scrap a deeply contentious security pact with China if they manage to oust Prime Minister Manasseh Sogavare in elections this April.

title.children: What the Solomon Islands election means for China ties

image.altText: Woman in Papua New Guinea sits at street side table with groupings of green looking fruit, betel nut, for sale.

props.synopsis: Selling buai is one of the few options for financial stability for people like Ruth, who move from the provinces to Port Moresby only to find there is little formal employment. Here's why there's a growing demand for the addictive seed.

title.children: 'Everyone loves their coffee; we love our betel nut': Inside PNG's betel nut boom

image.altText: Students in a classroom with male teacher in background.

props.synopsis: Child and education advocates say the figures should be a "wake-up call" that schools need more funding and support to manage at-risk students.

title.children: 'Wake-up call': Police called by NSW public primary and special needs schools more than 860 times last year

image.altText: Ian Bodill looks at a laptop screen while sitting in his office.

props.synopsis: Another chief executive resigns at the beleaguered Barkly Regional Council based in Tennant Creek, which is currently under investigation over governance concerns.

title.children: Third CEO in 12 months resigns from embattled outback NT council
